text:
Pushcarts at S. E. corner of Ninth Avenue and 41st Street. October 6, 1927.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

Ninth Avenue at S. W. corner of 41st Street.
October 6, 1927.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1)
401-427 West 41st Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Ninth Avenue. The Knox Memorial Collegiate (Dutch Reformed), Church is at No. 407. October 6, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, six years later, not including Ninth Avenue. June 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
401-427 West 41st Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Ninth Avenue. The Knox Memorial Collegiate (Dutch Reformed), Church is at No. 407. October 6, 1927.

(2)

(1) West 41st Street, south side, west from (No. 408), but not including Ninth Ave. Shown in the foreground, at Nos. 418-420, is an old church, occupied in the 1890's by Zion chapel, and used later by a Greek Congregation, after some years of secular use.
NEG # 3472 June 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, slightly westward. In the background, appears the spire of St. Raphael's R.C. Church.
August 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(1) West 41st Street, south side, west from (No. 408), but not including Ninth Ave. Shown in the foreground, at Nos. 418-420, is an old church, occupied in the 1890's by Zion chapel, and used later by a Greek Congregation, after some years of secular use.

41st Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Ninth Avenue, showing the Knox Memorial Church, (Dutch Reformed), at 407 West 41st Street.

P. L. Sperr.

April 8, 1933.

(1)
41st Street, north side, east from No. 417 West 41st Street, west of Ninth Avenue, showing the new McGraw-Hill Building at No. 337-327. June 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from and including Tenth Ave.

July 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

418 West 41st Street, south side, west of Ninth Avenue. This is an old church, occupied in the 1890's by Zion Chapel, and was occupied by a Greek congregation after some years of secular use.

June 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Ninth Avenue, west side, north from and including 41st Street.
April 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Approximately the same vantage point but in a northeastward direction.
The Hotel Holland seen above the El is on the north side of West 42nd Street, slightly east of Ninth Ave.

P. L. Sperr.

December 10, 1937.

April 30, 1934.

title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Fruit and vegetables.

text:
Flowers and refreshments for sale near Ninth Ave., and 41st Street.

April 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Miscellaneous.

text:
41st Street, south side, east from No. 464, adjoining the S.E. corner of Tenth Avenue, to and including Ninth Avenue.

May 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Peddlers-food-fruit: A market scene on the west side of Ninth Ave. between West 42nd and 41st Streets, as seen from the Elevated Station at 42nd Street. This, a retail general produce market extends for several
blocks south of this point.

About 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Fruit.

text:
West 41st Street (immediate foreground) south side, between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, showing a clearance extending southward several blocks. Dyer Avenue will be constructed here and form a vehicular approach to the new Lincoln Tunnel. The tenement seen in the path of this demolition is No. 424-26 W. 39th Street.

May 15, 1938.

P. L. Sperr,
